name: Best Pizza
description: Starting off our journey, walk a few blocks from the Bedford Ave station to Best Pizza, where you'll find a thin crispy piece. Fresh out of their century-old, wood-burning oven, these slices are quintessentially New York.

name: Mo's General
description: You'll find Mo's General on the other side of the BQE, but it's a trek worth making. Fluffy, foccacia-like squares are this shop's highlight, with a crisp and light dough, generous cheese, and a touch of sauce.

name: L'Industrie
description: L'Industrie is one of the most well-known pizzerias in Williamsburg, recently expanding to their 2nd location. Their lines can be long, but it's well worth the wait. Their New Yorker slice with basil and ricotta, fig & bacon, and burrata pizzas are also some of my favorite slices in New York.

name: Fini Pizza
description: Check out Fini for its lemony White pizza or the Long hot pepper and shallot, signature flavors that are unique to other New York slices.

name: Joe's Pizza
description: Joe's isn't a slice exclusive to Williamsburg, but it's an old reliable and a great baseline. Swing by if you want a comparison to the classic Manhattan brand.

name: Vinnie's
description: Vinnie's also has unique flavors, like its Elote pizza or the Mac and cheese pie. The previous tenant of our apartment Leonard was a long-time fan.
